com.github.fivekwbassmachine.jutils

Class CommandLineArguments

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.fivekwbassmachine.jutils.CommandLineArguments

  • public class CommandLineArguments
extends java.lang.Object
    This data type is a better format for command line arguments.

    There are 3 type of parsable arguments: - Keys with only one letter which can occur onetime or repeated and don't have a value: -[key] -[key1][...][key n] - Keys with multiple letters which can only occur onetime and don't have a value: --[key] - Keys with multiple letters which can only occur onetime and have a value: --[key] [value]

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        returns the arguments as a String with the default title.

        Default title: Arguments:\n Bug: The method returns the arguments in no particular order. This could be fixed with using a LinkedHashMap for arguments to keep the order. Actually, this shouldn't be required.

        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        The arguments.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString(java.lang.String title)
        returns the arguments as a String with a custom title.

        Bug: The method returns the arguments in no particular order. This could be fixed with using a LinkedHashMap for arguments to keep the order. Actually, this shouldn't be required.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The arguments.
        Since:

      • getType

        public CommandLineArguments.ArgumentType getType(java.lang.String arg)
        returns the CommandLineArguments.ArgumentType of the argument.

        Returns - CommandLineArguments.ArgumentType.KEY When the argument is a key. - CommandLineArguments.ArgumentType.PAIR When the argument is a key-value-pair. - CommandLineArguments.ArgumentType.NONE When the argument does not exist.

        Parameters:
        arg - The argument.
        Returns:
        The type of the argument.
        Since:
        1.0.0

      • getType

        public CommandLineArguments.ArgumentType getType(java.lang.String arg,
                                                 java.lang.String altArg)
        returns the CommandLineArguments.ArgumentType of the argument, if it doesn't exist the one of the alternative argument.

        Returns - CommandLineArguments.ArgumentType.KEY When the argument is a key. - CommandLineArguments.ArgumentType.PAIR When the argument is a key-value-pair. - CommandLineArguments.ArgumentType.NONE When the argument does not exist.

        Parameters:
        arg - The argument.
        altArg - The alternative argument.
        Returns:
        The type of the argument.
        Since:
        1.0.0
